revised_title: Electromotive Phenomena in Mammalian Non-medullated Nerve
tldr: This study investigates the electromotive phenomena in mammalian non-medullated nerves, focusing on the negative variation and electrotonic currents. The results show that non-medullated nerves have a more rapid decrease in negative variation compared to medullated nerves, and the subsequent responses are greater for a time after rest but soon fall off.
